main

Enum MonomerDirection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<MonomerDirection>
      • main.MonomerDirection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<MonomerDirection>

    public enum MonomerDirection
extends java.lang.Enum<MonomerDirection>
    The discrete directions, in which a monomer may turn, compared to its predecessor.

      • getPosition

        public static javax.vecmath.Vector3f[] getPosition(javax.vecmath.Vector3f[] vecs,
                                   MonomerDirection relativeDirection)
        Gets the position if the previous monomer and a relative direction, and return the position of the current monomer. This function calculates the direction in the same way as Monomer.calculateVectors().
        Parameters:
        vecs - A vector of Vector3f representing the position of the previous monomer.
        • vecs[0] = r vector, absolute position.
        • vecs[1] = o vector, helper vector for calculation.
        • vecs[2] = s vector, helper vector for calculation.
        relativeDirection - the direction from the previous monomer to the current.
        Returns:
        An array of vectors with the same format as vecs argument.
